translation: potępienie [the act of sending someone to hell or the state of being in hell]
sentence: He believed that he would be condemned to eternal damnation for what he had done.

translation: polana [literary; a small area of grass without trees in a forest]
sentence: There were several small woodland glades dominated by various grasses.
It's the penultimate episode of the series tonight.

translation: spadać gwałtownie, zanurzyć [to (cause someone or something to) move or fall suddenly and often a long way forward, down, or into something]
sentence: We ran down to the beach and plunged into the sea.

translation: pogarda, lekceważenie [a very strong feeling of no respect for someone or something that you think is stupid or has no value]
sentence: She has nothing but scorn for the new generation of politicians.

translation: sofistyka [formal; the use of intelligent arguments to persuade people that something is true when it is really false]
sentence: Convincing myself that I had gained in some way from my loss was just pure sophistry.

translation: zataczać się, chwiać się na nogach [to walk or move with difficulty as if you are going to fall]
sentence: After he was attacked, he managed to stagger to the phone and call for help.

translation: zaniedbany, rozczochrany [disapproving; untidy; not cared for]
sentence: He needed a shave and his hair was unkempt.

translation: salwa, seria [a lot of bullets, stones, etc. that are fired or thrown at the same time; a lot of similar things that are said or produced, or that happen, quickly one after the other]
sentence: Police fired a volley over the heads of the crowd. I'm afraid my proposal was met with a volley of criticisms.
